summary: In 2012, Puerto Rico enacted tax incentives to encourage relocation to and investment in Puerto Rico, including preferential tax rates on investment and export service income. Puerto Rico residents can also receive a federal income tax exemption if they meet certain requirements. The overall effect on Puerto Rico’s economy of the incentives is difficult to isolate. We found that, on average, incentive recipients were high-income...
title: Puerto Rico: IRS Should Improve Oversight of Taxpayers Claiming Exemption from Federal Taxes
